commit_message:
Use safer methods to get security groups on security group logging

There is a chance on real environment that a port group doesn't have any
correspondent security group (and there are maintenance tasks that will
remove them). This patch avoids a DriverError from Neutron in case we
are in an environment with a port group that was mistakenly left over
due to any reason. Instead, a Warning log will be raised.

Related-bug: #2032929
Change-Id: I42208557c8522d6fbc29df8a3c7d0367cace31e4
(cherry picked from commit 67bd591c5b9280f1af7c8a4942dcbb3bd1270cfb)

subject: Add is_admin to safe fields list for notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-09-26 08:08:23.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/notify/notifier.py'], 'message': "Add is_admin to safe fields list for notifications

We encountered bug 2037312 in unit tests when attempting to get this
change rolled out. Heat apparently will attempt to set is_admin using
policy logic if it's not passed in for a new context; this breaks as the
context we are requested doesn't have all the needed information to
exercise the policy logic.

is_admin is just a bool; it's not sensitive; easiest route forward is to
add it to the safe list

Closes-bug: 2037312
Change-Id: I78b08edfcb8115cddd7de9c6c788c0a57c8218a8
(cherry picked from commit c1b606f77e69a2829fcfdb74b8b3f646d4b60929)
"}]
commit_message:
Add is_admin to safe fields list for notifications

We encountered bug 2037312 in unit tests when attempting to get this
change rolled out. Heat apparently will attempt to set is_admin using
policy logic if it's not passed in for a new context; this breaks as the
context we are requested doesn't have all the needed information to
exercise the policy logic.

is_admin is just a bool; it's not sensitive; easiest route forward is to
add it to the safe list

Closes-bug: 2037312
Change-Id: I78b08edfcb8115cddd7de9c6c788c0a57c8218a8
(cherry picked from commit c1b606f77e69a2829fcfdb74b8b3f646d4b60929)

commit_message:
Add is_admin to safe fields list for notifications

We encountered bug 2037312 in unit tests when attempting to get this
change rolled out. Heat apparently will attempt to set is_admin using
policy logic if it's not passed in for a new context; this breaks as the
context we are requested doesn't have all the needed information to
exercise the policy logic.

is_admin is just a bool; it's not sensitive; easiest route forward is to
add it to the safe list

Closes-bug: 2037312
Change-Id: I78b08edfcb8115cddd7de9c6c788c0a57c8218a8

subject: ExtractProvisionedNode - include removed_rsrc
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-09-22 19:05:07.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_node/test_overcloud_node.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_node.py'], 'message': "ExtractProvisionedNode - include removed_rsrc

Get the removed_rsrc_list for each ResourceGroup in the stack.
When building the instances list, add entries with 'provisioned': false
if the current index is in removed_rsrc_list and no replacement using
the same hostname exist.

We no longer sort entries from AnsibleHostVarsMap, I think sorting might
actually be problematic in a corner case where HostnameMap was used to
give nodes non-sort friendly names like:
  overcloud-controller-0: non
  overcloud-controller-1: sort
  overcloud-controller-2: friendly

Sorting ^^ would result:
  overcloud-controller-0: friendly
  overcloud-controller-1: non
  overcloud-controller-2: sort

Resolves: RHBZ#2238349
Change-Id: I30d5ac4921af584b2a234880aafa20bbcaea052d
"}]
commit_message:
ExtractProvisionedNode - include removed_rsrc

Get the removed_rsrc_list for each ResourceGroup in the stack.
When building the instances list, add entries with 'provisioned': false
if the current index is in removed_rsrc_list and no replacement using
the same hostname exist.

We no longer sort entries from AnsibleHostVarsMap, I think sorting might
actually be problematic in a corner case where HostnameMap was used to
give nodes non-sort friendly names like:
  overcloud-controller-0: non
  overcloud-controller-1: sort
  overcloud-controller-2: friendly

Sorting ^^ would result:
  overcloud-controller-0: friendly
  overcloud-controller-1: non
  overcloud-controller-2: sort

Resolves: RHBZ#2238349
Change-Id: I30d5ac4921af584b2a234880aafa20bbcaea052d

commit_message:
Release 1.0.0 of sushy-tools

Sushy-tools is used in production CI for Ironic and many other places.
Lets make it a 1.x.y release.

Also, this has not been released in several months, and includes many
enhancements to the fake driver modes.

Change-Id: I6cbdc0a4c20b2d152207ea250bd03ab7c880f756

commit_message:
Set 'tenant_name_discovery' parameter in 'polling' section

As of now 'tenant_name_discovery'[1] is being configured in 'DEFAULT' section in ceilometer config file.

As per Ceilometer this must be configured as a polling option[2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/polling/manager.py#L69-L80
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/opts.py#L98

Change-Id: Ib5c273df325f5ed0dccf7f45a9c7a91aba9568c3
(cherry picked from commit 204a8b398d0ccc25d074f85e55641b369ad716b7)

subject: tests: Add test(s) for MPU part copy from range
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2023-09-18 20:26:31.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py', 'test/functional/s3api/__init__.py', 'test/functional/s3api/test_multi_upload.py', 'test/functional/s3api/test_object.py'], 'message': "tests: Add test(s) for MPU part copy from range

When using the copy-part API it is expected for s3api to write down an
empty value for X-Object-Sysmeta-S3Api-Etag on segments.  This was
ostensibly to prevent writing down an unrelated S3Api-Etag when copying
a part from another MPU the copy transfers object sysmeta.  We should
assume a S3Api-Etag w/o X-Static-Large-Object is non-sense, and SLO
should forever expect empty values for it's sysmeta.

Drive-By: consolidate handling of boto2 sigv4 skips

Related-Bug: #2035158
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic6f04a5a6af8a3e65b226cff2ed6c9fce8ce1fa2
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Add test(s) for MPU part copy from range

When using the copy-part API it is expected for s3api to write down an
empty value for X-Object-Sysmeta-S3Api-Etag on segments.  This was
ostensibly to prevent writing down an unrelated S3Api-Etag when copying
a part from another MPU the copy transfers object sysmeta.  We should
assume a S3Api-Etag w/o X-Static-Large-Object is non-sense, and SLO
should forever expect empty values for it's sysmeta.

Drive-By: consolidate handling of boto2 sigv4 skips

Related-Bug: #2035158
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic6f04a5a6af8a3e65b226cff2ed6c9fce8ce1fa2

subject: Revert "Fix pin of pathspec in CentOS 9 Stream"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-09-22 05:46:55.000000000', 'files': ['puppet-openstack_spec_helper.gemspec'], 'message': 'Revert "Fix pin of pathspec in CentOS 9 Stream"

This reverts commit 2b1b5641e0fa6e58aeb58e82e50f5b5dc774aefd.

Reason for revert:
Without this gem attempts to install a newer version of puppetlabs
spec helper which requires pathspec 1.0.0. With that version of
spec helper we have seen that most of puppet jobs fail with
the error below.

```
NameError: uninitialized constant Puppet
```

Because we no longer see an issue with CentOS 9 Stream now, this
reverts the commit so that we use the same approach in zed and
older releases.

The error is not seen in stable/2023.1 and later, because of
unpinned puppet-lint, so this revert is submitted to stable/zed.
(The original change was merged during zed cycle).

Change-Id: I2bb419c83d5ba6969d262ae2966ceac822bf67fc
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix pin of pathspec in CentOS 9 Stream"

This reverts commit 2b1b5641e0fa6e58aeb58e82e50f5b5dc774aefd.

Reason for revert:
Without this gem attempts to install a newer version of puppetlabs
spec helper which requires pathspec 1.0.0. With that version of
spec helper we have seen that most of puppet jobs fail with
the error below.

```
NameError: uninitialized constant Puppet
```

Because we no longer see an issue with CentOS 9 Stream now, this
reverts the commit so that we use the same approach in zed and
older releases.

The error is not seen in stable/2023.1 and later, because of
unpinned puppet-lint, so this revert is submitted to stable/zed.
(The original change was merged during zed cycle).

Change-Id: I2bb419c83d5ba6969d262ae2966ceac822bf67fc

commit_message:
Fix pointless-string-statement pylint warning

For some reason, kilo_initial.py is triggering this warning,
so fix it by using comments instead of a docstring.

Also updated the template to use comments as well, so any
migrations created in the future use them, even though
none seem to be causing a similar warning right now.

Closes-bug: #2036763
Change-Id: I63b7ac83fdd3ebc6251979f1376daf2105489fdc

subject: Disable auto-discovery for setuptools
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-09-25 17:26:31.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'setup.py'], 'message': "Disable auto-discovery for setuptools

With the latest setuptools release (61.0.0) ansible-role-atos-hsm's
package build command (python3 setup.py sdist bdist_wheel) started to
fail:

error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['defaults', 'handlers', 'templates', 'releasenotes'].

This issue is mentioned in setuptools bug 3197 [1], and the suggested
workaround is to disable auto-discovery by adding 'py_modules=[]' in
setup.py.

ansible-lint also released a new version (6.0.0), which has new rules
that blocks the gate. As a workaround, this patch caps ansible-lint
version <6.0.0 to unblock the gate.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Change-Id: I3f827b3ed855ff46292dee7b21b74a622adc472d
(cherry picked from commit f5c86dff4ee246f0ecbfb2d753e2c90912e7bb02)
(cherry picked from commit 6a028735e1340ececc01552c1091aaef69230895)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable auto-discovery for setuptools

With the latest setuptools release (61.0.0) ansible-role-atos-hsm's
package build command (python3 setup.py sdist bdist_wheel) started to
fail:

error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['defaults', 'handlers', 'templates', 'releasenotes'].

This issue is mentioned in setuptools bug 3197 [1], and the suggested
workaround is to disable auto-discovery by adding 'py_modules=[]' in
setup.py.

ansible-lint also released a new version (6.0.0), which has new rules
that blocks the gate. As a workaround, this patch caps ansible-lint
version <6.0.0 to unblock the gate.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Change-Id: I3f827b3ed855ff46292dee7b21b74a622adc472d
(cherry picked from commit f5c86dff4ee246f0ecbfb2d753e2c90912e7bb02)
(cherry picked from commit 6a028735e1340ececc01552c1091aaef69230895)

subject: stable-only: Constrain the upper Ansible version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-09-18 20:31:25.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "stable-only: Constrain the upper Ansible version

On CI nodes, we get the latest ansible version, generally,
such as 2.9.15.

However, this code was originally developed on 2.8.x, *and*
utilizes an older openstacksdk version which comes from our
requirements and stable branch upper constraints, for example
openstacksdk 0.101.0 being the current version on the Zed branch.

However, Ansible 2.9 is incompatible with versions of the SDK
gerater than 0.99.0. To make matters worse, Ansible expects
SDK version greater than 1.0 because there are breaking changes
for the SDK which they navigated at the 1.0 route.

So since we're on an older stable branch, lets constrain our
test run ansible version so we don't end up failing the CI
job because our base ansible is too new for the software we
are trying to test.

Presently planning to backport this on stable branches so we
can unbrick IPA stable branches.

Change-Id: I67a3397f53e03270ac3ce540042f188991cd2bac
(cherry picked from commit 176f48ed8671656d6d5a20e37215b849ac0978c1)
"}]
commit_message:
stable-only: Constrain the upper Ansible version

On CI nodes, we get the latest ansible version, generally,
such as 2.9.15.

However, this code was originally developed on 2.8.x, *and*
utilizes an older openstacksdk version which comes from our
requirements and stable branch upper constraints, for example
openstacksdk 0.101.0 being the current version on the Zed branch.

However, Ansible 2.9 is incompatible with versions of the SDK
gerater than 0.99.0. To make matters worse, Ansible expects
SDK version greater than 1.0 because there are breaking changes
for the SDK which they navigated at the 1.0 route.

So since we're on an older stable branch, lets constrain our
test run ansible version so we don't end up failing the CI
job because our base ansible is too new for the software we
are trying to test.

Presently planning to backport this on stable branches so we
can unbrick IPA stable branches.

Change-Id: I67a3397f53e03270ac3ce540042f188991cd2bac
(cherry picked from commit 176f48ed8671656d6d5a20e37215b849ac0978c1)

subject: This is a combination of 2 commits.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-09-22 19:01:25.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/unregister_client.yaml', '.gitreview', 'tasks/main.yaml', 'tasks/register_client.yaml'], 'message': 'This is a combination of 2 commits.

Update .gitreview for stable/2023.1

Change-Id: I3cfc4bc90180d18e82608083bb3e887f8a789250

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.2 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9fbf50fc8019ada76374bdb7e51a0c39b0005dfa
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.2

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.2 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9fbf50fc8019ada76374bdb7e51a0c39b0005dfa

commit_message:
[www] Remove deprecated projects from project data template

Telemetry team's panko project was retired [1] some time ago already,
Winstackers team's projects were retired [2] recently. These are not
needed anymore in our project data template.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/850005
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/886880

Change-Id: Iea069d2f0b585c3ac56fd44a4048adf78fcfb9c2

subject: Add cluster-user-trust config option
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-09-25 14:11:03.000000000', 'files': ['config.yaml', 'src/templates/parts/section-trust'], 'message': "Add cluster-user-trust config option

Clusters created with the option cloud_provider_enabled or
registry_enabled set to true, or volumer_driver set to 'cinder' need
this flag set to True as well to instruct Magnum to assign trust to the
cluster user.

This option defaults to False due to security concerns (see
https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/cve/2016-7404 )

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/magnum/latest/user/index.html#cloud-provider-enabled

Related-Bug: #1996237
Change-Id: Ia3eea4f2a9565cf9ffd48889b9fc14e83c551644
"}]
commit_message:
Add cluster-user-trust config option

Clusters created with the option cloud_provider_enabled or
registry_enabled set to true, or volumer_driver set to 'cinder' need
this flag set to True as well to instruct Magnum to assign trust to the
cluster user.

This option defaults to False due to security concerns (see
https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/cve/2016-7404 )

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/magnum/latest/user/index.html#cloud-provider-enabled

Related-Bug: #1996237
Change-Id: Ia3eea4f2a9565cf9ffd48889b9fc14e83c551644

commit_message:
Remove test duplication between tempest and n-t-p RoutersDVRTest

RoutersDVRTest - https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-\
plugin/src/branch/master/neutron_tempest_plugin/api/admin/\
test_routers_dvr.py has same functionality in tempest and
neutron-tempest-plugin, so with removing these tests from tempest
we can get rid of whole module, reducing the test duplications.

subject: Fix race condition in members batch update API call
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-09-15 07:53:47.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/api/v2/controllers/member.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-race-condition-member-batch-update-1aed0e06004c5dad.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix race condition in members batch update API call

Fix a potential race condition, the member batch update API call
computes a delta between the current state of the members in the DB and
the members in the requests. But it fetches the members from the DB
before locking the load balancer, it means that another Octavia service
may still update the list of members, then the computation of the
changes may be incorrect.

The list of members is now queried in the locked section.

Closes-Bug: #2036156
Change-Id: I453ff385620f488a3e43d4fda01634cdce3be5d4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in members batch update API call

Fix a potential race condition, the member batch update API call
computes a delta between the current state of the members in the DB and
the members in the requests. But it fetches the members from the DB
before locking the load balancer, it means that another Octavia service
may still update the list of members, then the computation of the
changes may be incorrect.

The list of members is now queried in the locked section.

Closes-Bug: #2036156
Change-Id: I453ff385620f488a3e43d4fda01634cdce3be5d4

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-27 15:03:32.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/new-variable-designate-backend-bind9-workers-cfd4676196410c6a.yaml', 'ansible/roles/designate/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/designate/templates/designate-backend-bind9.json.j2'], 'message': 'Specify number of threads for designate bind9 backend

Bind9 is running without limit for UDP listeners.
This patch is changing this behaviour and sets max 32
of UDP listeners. This is needed because of bug below [1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/bind9/+bug/1827923

Change-Id: Ie4c2ac4d5e990ebdc30c3a94d855703d814f1fee

commit_message:
Specify number of threads for designate bind9 backend

Bind9 is running without limit for UDP listeners.
This patch is changing this behaviour and sets max 32
of UDP listeners. This is needed because of bug below [1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/bind9/+bug/1827923

Change-Id: Ie4c2ac4d5e990ebdc30c3a94d855703d814f1fee
(cherry picked from commit 02ce483852341fee2d913aa612e2a50f73b7eb7e)

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.2 branch, tests will

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.2

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.2 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1624a8a7f739ddd41ab0056dcb810b3eccae076d

subject: Pin Gnocchi 4.5.1 to Zed release
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2023-09-20 12:04:26.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Pin Gnocchi 4.5.1 to Zed release

Instead of setting Gnocchi version through localrc configuration, it
is hardcoded in devstack settings. A particular stable release
of OpenStack is not expected to be tested with multiple Gnocchi
releases and therefore the version pinned in this release is not expected to change.

Closes-Bug: #2035074
Change-Id: I60e9716555999f19d360b8219b9539c88622e07f
(cherry picked from commit f47af941f7134ddecf65b19f12d1a325ba54fded)
'}]
commit_message:
Pin Gnocchi 4.5.1 to Zed release

Instead of setting Gnocchi version through localrc configuration, it
is hardcoded in devstack settings. A particular stable release
of OpenStack is not expected to be tested with multiple Gnocchi
releases and therefore the version pinned in this release is not expected to change.

Closes-Bug: #2035074
Change-Id: I60e9716555999f19d360b8219b9539c88622e07f
(cherry picked from commit f47af941f7134ddecf65b19f12d1a325ba54fded)

subject: Use safer methods to get security groups on security group logging
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-09-18 11:52:22.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/services/logapi/drivers/ovn/test_driver.py', 'neutron/services/logapi/drivers/ovn/driver.py'], 'message': "Use safer methods to get security groups on security group logging

There is a chance on real environment that a port group doesn't have any
correspondent security group (and there are maintenance tasks that will
remove them). This patch avoids a DriverError from Neutron in case we
are in an environment with a port group that was mistakenly left over
due to any reason. Instead, a Warning log will be raised.

Related-bug: #2032929
Change-Id: I42208557c8522d6fbc29df8a3c7d0367cace31e4
"}]
commit_message:
Use safer methods to get security groups on security group logging

There is a chance on real environment that a port group doesn't have any
correspondent security group (and there are maintenance tasks that will
remove them). This patch avoids a DriverError from Neutron in case we
are in an environment with a port group that was mistakenly left over
due to any reason. Instead, a Warning log will be raised.

Related-bug: #2032929
Change-Id: I42208557c8522d6fbc29df8a3c7d0367cace31e4

subject: [Docs] Update release management part
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-09-12 01:31:09.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/release_management.rst'], 'message': "[Docs] Update release management part

- Reflects that now stable versions are created after release
  without early creation of the versions and merging to master
- cycle-with-milestones has been replaced by cycle-with-rc model
- Horizon is now following cycle-with-intermediary.
  Let's follow the same description as project-team-guide/release-management.
- Replace a term: from Forum/Design Summit to PTG

Change-Id: Id0ca964786a4a9cf2287b008d845f4c3a1a22e77
"}]
commit_message:
[Docs] Update release management part

- Reflects that now stable versions are created after release
  without early creation of the versions and merging to master
- cycle-with-milestones has been replaced by cycle-with-rc model
- Horizon is now following cycle-with-intermediary.
  Let's follow the same description as project-team-guide/release-management.
- Replace a term: from Forum/Design Summit to PTG

Change-Id: Id0ca964786a4a9cf2287b008d845f4c3a1a22e77

subject: Partial revert "Fix gnocchi install from git"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-09-12 10:57:11.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/local.conf.sample', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Partial revert "Fix gnocchi install from git"

This reverts commit cb7084ed1868a29795364a83999842d8e671f4d0.

Reason for revert: This change allowed installing specific branch of Gnocchi. However, installing using tags would allow testing with released versions only. Since these releases will not have new commits added to them, CI jobs will result in less failures.

Change-Id: Ie601593ec4e25e5032501199258423ed96a93cbb
'}]
commit_message:
Partial revert "Fix gnocchi install from git"

This reverts commit cb7084ed1868a29795364a83999842d8e671f4d0.

Reason for revert: This change allowed installing specific branch of Gnocchi. However, installing using tags would allow testing with released versions only. Since these releases will not have new commits added to them, CI jobs will result in less failures.

Change-Id: Ie601593ec4e25e5032501199258423ed96a93cbb

subject: Use Fedora 38 images instead of 36
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-20 10:37:04.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Use Fedora 38 images instead of 36

Fedora 36 will reach eol on 2023-05-16 and these cloud images
may not be available later.

This change overrides parameter "HEAT_TEST_FEDORA_IMAGE_PATH"
in localrc to use Fedora 38 cloud image.

Change-Id: I9be069d2a651f2eb19d5137de5619870a9dc180f
'}]
commit_message:
Use Fedora 38 images instead of 36

Fedora 36 will reach eol on 2023-05-16 and these cloud images
may not be available later.

This change overrides parameter "HEAT_TEST_FEDORA_IMAGE_PATH"
in localrc to use Fedora 38 cloud image.

Change-Id: I9be069d2a651f2eb19d5137de5619870a9dc180f

commit_message:
Remove openeuler job from periodic and check queue

Nova requires version 7.0.0 or greater.

commit_message:
Use deploy-env role for all deployment jobs

To make it easier to maintain the jobs all experimental
jobs (those which are not run in check and gate pipelines)
are moved to a separate file. They will be revised later
to use the same deploy-env role.

Also many charts use Openstack images for testing this
PR adds 2023.1 Ubuntu Focal overrides for all these charts.

Change-Id: I4a6fb998c7eb1026b3c05ddd69f62531137b6e51

commit_message:
[stable-only] Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.2

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.2 branch, tests
will continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Idf5d8408ac2586be7a4cfd38fa83e39cfe08b87d

subject: Horizon: restrict access to Apache's server-status endpoint.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-26 23:53:18.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/horizon/templates/horizon.conf.j2'], 'message': "Horizon: restrict access to Apache's server-status endpoint.

Apache's server-status endpoint is currently reachable from any remote
client, which may be considered a vulnerability. This patch proposes
that querying server status is only allowed from localhost.

Change-Id: I34bbdf8f4bbf53f2f989db5176862b3020be636b
Signed-off-by: German Espinoza <gespinoza@whitestack.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Horizon: restrict access to Apache's server-status endpoint.

Apache's server-status endpoint is currently reachable from any remote
client, which may be considered a vulnerability. This patch proposes
that querying server status is only allowed from localhost.

Change-Id: I34bbdf8f4bbf53f2f989db5176862b3020be636b
Signed-off-by: German Espinoza <gespinoza@whitestack.com>

This bump breaks docs gates, for example Aodh [0]

we should wait until wsme fix a45e0af97e2e8362277f160d0f2b737590e367d1
to support sphinx >5.0 is released before bumping Sphinx

This reverts commit 289feed31747cbd922ef9d4a8df9ca87084b10a7.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 20248, 'name': 'Jaymes Mosher', 'email': 'jmosher@mirantis.com', 'username': 'jmosher'}, {'_account_id': 21040, 'name': 'Alexey', 'email': 'aodinokov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aodinokov'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 29974, 'name': 'Stephen Taylor', 'email': 'stephen.taylor.1@att.com', 'username': 'st053q'}, {'_account_id': 34520, 'name': 'Sergiy Markin', 'email': 'smarkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sm515x'}, {'_account_id': 35948, 'name': 'Sergio Omar Munoz', 'display_name': 'Omar Munoz', 'email': 'om9464@att.com', 'username': 'om9464'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2023-09-22 20:50:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/Chart.yaml', 'neutron/templates/bin/_neutron-server.sh.tpl', 'releasenotes/notes/neutron.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix start function template

The template contains extra backslashes which can cause the start function
to contain extra backslashes, ie:

function start () {
  exec neutron-server \
        --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf \ \
        --config-file /etc/neutron/taas_plugin.ini \ \
        --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/sriov_agent.ini \
        --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
}

With this change the function templates correctly.

Change-Id: I9f8ceb203a0039a83ee49c76d6891f7380a6cc08
'}]
commit_message:
Fix start function template

The template contains extra backslashes which can cause the start function
to contain extra backslashes, ie:

function start () {
  exec neutron-server \
        --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf \ \
        --config-file /etc/neutron/taas_plugin.ini \ \
        --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/sriov_agent.ini \
        --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
}

With this change the function templates correctly.

Change-Id: I9f8ceb203a0039a83ee49c76d6891f7380a6cc08

The former is required to fix Sphinx >= 5.0 compatibility across
projects that use WSME and its Sphinx extension (aodh, solum, mistral,

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Bump wsme to 0.12.1, sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme to 0.11.0

The former is required to fix Sphinx >= 5.0 compatibility across
projects that use WSME and its Sphinx extension (aodh, solum, mistral,
...). The latter is a minimal update required to fix Python 3.11
compatibility.

Change-Id: I73cc90c0a5450b75274d12d2533d05e174f1f90e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

subject: [train-only] Fix grubenv linking for minor update
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-09-19 18:47:53.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/tripleo-packages/tripleo-packages-baremetal-puppet.yaml'], 'message': '[train-only] Fix grubenv linking for minor update

/boot/grub2/grubenv should be symlink to /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv
on uEFI machines. During deployment[1] on uEFI machines we create both
/boot/grub2/grubenv and /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv as regular files.
This breaks boot during minor update on second and later kernel update
on the same rhel version as grub package will not override save_entry
with newer kernel version in /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv during kernel
update, but in /boot/grub2/grubenv instead. Linking is required to be
fixed before yum update step to get correct entry on the nearest kernel
update.

Resolves: rhbz#2233095
[1]https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/src/branch/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_kernel/tasks/kernelargs.yml#L159

Change-Id: I31b50563a8d4662fdb7177d97c86f6d9d40cb28b
'}]
commit_message:
[train-only] Fix grubenv linking for minor update

/boot/grub2/grubenv should be symlink to /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv
on uEFI machines. During deployment[1] on uEFI machines we create both
/boot/grub2/grubenv and /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv as regular files.
This breaks boot during minor update on second and later kernel update
on the same rhel version as grub package will not override save_entry
with newer kernel version in /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv during kernel
update, but in /boot/grub2/grubenv instead. Linking is required to be
fixed before yum update step to get correct entry on the nearest kernel
update.

Resolves: rhbz#2233095
[1]https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/src/branch/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_kernel/tasks/kernelargs.yml#L159

Change-Id: I31b50563a8d4662fdb7177d97c86f6d9d40cb28b

commit_message:
ovn-migration: Change undercloud user to tripleo-admin

The default user was changed from heat-admin to tripleo-admin in
TripleO. This change is to reflect this by default in the migration
script.

Change-Id: Idc09473527ced3b0a0259f21ae8aa10762c74481
